website_summaries.verdict: Small but mighty - if you are looking for quality and value, you won't find a better deal.
pros: Air operated and fully automatic performance provides precise flow of grease
Has a flexible yet rugged 30-inch hose
cons: Valves have a tendency to stick on some units, but it doesn't seem to be a persistent issue

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of these. The BOTH leak Oil!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe it! I bought 2 of these for the various greases needed for my small helicopter. They BOTH leaked oil! I came to the hangar one day and the shelf of the storage cabinet I keep my grease guns on was covered in oil. It took me a few minutes to determine that one of these blue Lincolns was leaking. I put the two of them in individual plastic bags and came back the next day. They were both leaking oil! DO NOT BUY THESE - they are CRAP.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Monk

customer_reviews.title: Air bound!
customer_reviews.text: I own other Lincoln guns and was excited to get a pistol grip type gun. At first it worked great and I was able to cut grease time down in half and then....it stopped working! I did everything to clear air bubbles and nothing worked. I even switched grease handles and nothing. Ended up just throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: John Moore

customer_reviews.title: Plunger Doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a very well built grease gun, maybe too well built. The plunger will not go into the grease cartridge, at least not a plastic one. This obviously prevents the grease from being fed. I was able to manually force the plunger in while completely disassembled but couldn't reassemble in that state
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I put a grease cartridge in and hung it on my wall, 2 hoes later when I returned the grease was leaking out from every single threading and orifice. I checked to be sure that everything was tight but I guess it needs Teflon tape. It's still going to leak from the plunger shaft though.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S. Tanton

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION BEFORE YOU BUY !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that all grease fittings (zerk) are not the same size. You may need to purchase a few different Quick Connect Couplers of different sizes. The one that comes with this unit does not fit any of my grease fittings on my Mahindra tractor. I was surprised as this unit is also a foreign made brand. Also keep in mind that the threads on this unit are metric. You will damage the threads if you try to use couplers of inch sizes. Anyway, after replacing the coupler with the proper size, the gun works well.
customer_reviews.author: Low Tech Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Good luck loading it.
customer_reviews.text: I know that loading these things can be a mess at times, but this one takes the cake. this seems to get air bound very easy and is hard to get the air pocket out. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: BLR

customer_reviews.title: Works so much better than my cheap small grease gun
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small (3oz ?) no name grease gun from a big box store and I could never get it to pump grease. I started researching on youtube for tips and tricks to get the grease gun working to no avail. So I decided to get a full size gun that was more like what I was seeing on YT. Bought this one because of good reviews on Amazon. This one works so much better than my other one. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Coombs

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: You are better off catching your money on fire. After “greasing” 24 fittings with this gun & wasting 3x 16$ tubes of grease, this gun now has a new home in the intersection 3 houses down from my drive where I threw it. The coupler will absolutely not inject grease what so ever. All the grease mushrooms out around the sides of the coupler. I have 11$ Walmart grease guns that work 150% better than this.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Useless grease gun
customer_reviews.text: The head of this grease gun does not fit the nipples of my Kubota tractor not the Toro zero turn. Grease leaks from around the head and even when I had someone to press the head on the nipple. To much hype and do not trust the huge number of reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Goodman

customer_reviews.title: ok gun with crummy connector
customer_reviews.text: gun appears well made but for me had 2 basic flaws.number 1-fitting for air hose connector too long for my hose connector.This was easily corrected with new fitting.2-coupler on end of hose is pure foreign junk.coupler had to be severely forced to engage standard zerk fitting. had to use vice grips to remove if it did by chancLincoln e snap on.Numerous people have pointed out this last defect.I just threw the junk part in trash,bought a $3 replacement at big box store.Lincoln needs to move back to USA or get out of business.Gun was easy to set up and purge.
customer_reviews.author: Arp in Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: A real time and arm saver.
customer_reviews.text: Love the tool, but it wasn't good out of the box. The original zerk fitting tip was junk. Could not get it on a zerk other than unscrewing it from the hose and pounding it on with a hammer. It didn't loosen up after doing that a few times either. Luckily I had another grease gun and was able to swap it out with one that worked. After that, what a great time saver this tool is. My tractor has over 30 grease points that have to be done every 10 or fewer hours.
customer_reviews.author: Best Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Ambigous but Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty grease gun. I would recommend watching a YouTube video on how to load grease since the instructions are pretty ambiguous if it’s your first time (like me). Used to lube the front u-joints of my 2016 F250 Super Duty. Only took about 5 pumps until full. I’d recommend loosely adding a zip tie for storage in a toolbox or service box since the handle moves freely as shown in picture.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This is their entry level gun, why doesn’t it work?
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions, took me several tries to get it working but finally got grease flowing. The second time I tried to use it, no grease flowing. Referred to the manual and tried the air bubble fix several times, but the rod would not engage the follower at all. By the time I was done trying, all of the grease squeezed out the back of the tube. A basic, mechanical grease gun like this should be foolproof, but this is not. It’s my first time trying a Lincoln product, and likely to be my last thanks to this.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Price

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This Lincoln Lubrication 1134 Heavy Duty Pistol Grip Grease Gun worked like a charm. If you pay close attention to the instructions on which way to flip the plunger for your type of loading (cartridge or bulk) it works fine. I did not have any of the priming problems that some have complained about ... just followed the instructions Since I will only be using it once a year to grease the lawn tractor, I cut a stick to length and wedged it so that it keeps spring pressure off of the plunger. Hopefully that will prevent grease from seeping behind the follower during storage.
customer_reviews.author: lectricfrets

customer_reviews.title: Good pistol grip grease gun
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my decades-old leaking grease gun with a pistol-grip version, and this one seems to be a good choice. I've only used it a few times so far, but I'm happy with the ease of use. Being able to pump the grease with a one-handed operation is great. Very easy to replace cartridges if you follow the priming instructions. No leaks or issues of any kind so far. Build quality seems to be quite good overall. I did replace the coupler with a LockNLube coupler, but that was just a personal choice - the coupler that came with it was quite OK.
customer_reviews.author: HokieFan

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Well I took a chance seeing a lot of mediocre reviews for this product....I should have heeded there warnings.Open the box ...read the instructions....novel idea,I know. Loaded cartridge...Burped the air ....Nothing...used the plunger to force the gun to prime still more nothing. Put it on the anvil and blasted it with the 20 lb sledge.....These are trash save your time money and aggravation. I will say they come with a nice hose on them. It may fit one of my good grease guns. Note: this is just my personal experience with this product other user experiences may be better....I would have a hard time believing that they could be any worse!
customer_reviews.author: not satisified

customer_reviews.title: I am a grease gun dunce
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few grease guns in the past. They have all been disasters with more grease on me than in the zerk. I assumed that since I have a degree in physics and I worked in tech for 40 years that a $15-$20 grease gun was the problem. So I bought this Lincoln grease gun. Well, I was partly correct. With a little frustration, I can get this gun to work, but have to bleed it two or three times whenever I grease up my tractor. At least this one has a bleed valve.
customer_reviews.author: kreuz

customer_reviews.title: This seems like a solid piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a solid piece of equipment. My one criticism concerns a black plastic cap that is inserted in the opening of the nozzle. I assume this is to keep the lubricating oil inside the mechanism before it is purchased. In any case, this cap has to be removed to thread the hose into the nozzle, and it took me about 10 minutes to get it out with some needle-nose pliers. Pieces kept breaking off, and I was worried about hurting the threads with the pliers. At one point, I thought it was totally stuck and wasn't sure if I'd be able to remove it...
customer_reviews.author: Flipperman2a2w

customer_reviews.title: Try to get the air purged out before use!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this item since June and never used it, but this month I opened it and got ready to grease my car and I can't get it to pump any grease at all, I tried to see if there was an air pocket in there, went thru all the procedures and trouble shooting methods but it still won't operate correctly! I like the design but just can't get no use out of it! My battery operated lincoln grease gun is very dependable! It seems as if the plunger is not working correctly!
customer_reviews.author: SARGE

customer_reviews.title: Plunger Leaks After 4 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun 4 yrs ago. It worked well until now. The grease is bypassing the plunger. I pump about 1/3 of the grease from the cartridge and then it acts as if the cartridge is empty. I unscrew the head and the plunger is at the top of the cartridge as if it is empty. When I pull the T-handle back to retract the plunger, all of the missing grease gets pushed out the bottom of the grease gun through the T-handle hole. I don’t recommend this grease gun because I can not find a replacement plunger available to fix my gun. I only got 4 years out of my gun.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Great grease gun, get one!
customer_reviews.text: This grease gun was a little pricey, but well made. It loaded fine and worked well from the start. No air bleeding needed. Tip- follow easy to read directions closely, but don’t attach the hose or pipe until you have pumped a couple times. A little grease is wasted, but it self bleeds air naturally. Once you see the grease, then attach the hose. Tip- don’t over tighten anything. Just snug it up. That way you won’t break fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Beerad

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and handle doesn't lock
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2015. Starting out the charge handle wouldn't lock back in the smaller hole. And you can't load the tube in without the handle retracted. Tried it and managed the first tube, wasting 1/2 the grease. The threads on the tube stripped out too easily. Head threads were okay. Today Sept 2020 tried to use it on my truck. Second tube I got so ticked threw the whole thing in a leaf bag. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well designed
customer_reviews.text: I have used manual cheap grease guns for decades. They leak and are always difficult in tight spots. This grease gun is well built. A few of my friends at a vehicle maintenance facility have this gun and the guns take abuse daily. Operational pressure is not listed but running it at about 90 psi has been spot on. Grease is delivered smoothly. The 30” reach is very convienient. I plan on adding a 90 degree grease zerk later.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Workman

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Chinese ones
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of fighting my two old grease guns (grease behind plunger, etc). Finished with buying cheap stuff from China that doesn’t last long and found this one made in India. Much more solid construction, easy to load with cartridges and the handle works smoothly. Have greased some ranch equipment and it did a good job. Only time will tell about the durability but it feels like it should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Texas 777

customer_reviews.title: Llincoln's Japanese branch is dishonest.
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to obtain a grease gun that can use a 14oz cartridge in Japan. I asked Lincoln's Japanese branch to quote this grease gun. However, no reply was received... I tried using it because it arrived, but it would be convenient to use a 14oz cartridge. It's really cumbersome to use 14oz cartridges in hand:-P This grease gun is a little big and heavy for Japanese hands, but it is really useful when used in combination with a clear cylinder.
customer_reviews.author: Hiroshi Ikeda

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: If this is your first grease gun read all of the instructions, review a couple of you tube vids on how to load a grease gun, and you will be good to go. Loading it was a breeze. Taking the air out was also very easy. I paired mine with a quick lock connect coupler for even easier one handed use. It comes with a ring to hold the handle closed for storage. I store mine in a can head end down to prevent leaks, and always ready for use. I am so glad I got this and retired my two handed pump style of 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: No more hand cramps!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite tools! I work on heavy equipment, sometimes you need to pump a couple tubes of grease at a time on these machines, this thing works like a dream! Just pull the trigger and it starts pumping. Changing tubes is easy and it primes itself quickly, unlike some of my hand pump grease guns where you have to fool around with them for 10 minutes to get the darn thing to start pumping grease. I bought a whip with a locking tip on it to add to this, makes it even better. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Mc KENZIE

customer_reviews.title: Loses Prime Often
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality materials and no wobble in the parts---it feels great in the hand and works smoothly with one hand, when it works. Biggest problem is the prime is lost after only a few pumps everytime. I've owned this pump for months trying to use it at work, and I've had coworkers try to figure it out too with no luck. Sadly, I wouldn't purchase this ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Horanano

customer_reviews.title: Be sure and check it out before the warranty runs out.
customer_reviews.text: Had to rework an off center weld in the main piston. It wouldn't let the piston cycle because it was pushing it off center so it couldn't cycle to pump grease. I bought this item and had it on the shelf for over a year before I tried to use it. I figured I'd never be able to get any satisfaction after having it this long so I disassembled it to see what was wrong. Got lucky. I fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for greasing fittings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, and added a Lock-N-Lube tip to it, and the combination is absolutely key to quick, easy greasing.. Greasing fittings is now so fast and fun, even some that are full of stuff are able to unclogged and greased (my hand one would pressurize to its max, but wouldn't clear the zerk fitting). Using a wire brush on the zerk is another step to clearing the fitting if they are clogged, but if I am in a hurry, this does the job without the brush 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: CalGuY

customer_reviews.title: Just spend the extra money and get this grease gun!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheap grease gun, which lasted for a little while. This time I just spent the extra 10 to 20 dollars and bought a quality grease gun. It works great!!! so much better than the lower priced grease guns. It's heavy duty and worth every penny. It will most likely be the last grease gun I will ever have to buy. Update: once again summer has arrived, and it is time to re grease my boat and RV trailers. This gun still works perfectly! When you prime the gun you will have to release some air that gets trapped. Use Google, and find a video if you are having issues.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Much better than manual grease guns
customer_reviews.text: I've used 7 tubes of grease through this gun so far and really like the performance. When the grease is empty in the gun, you can tell by the gun pumping twice as fast. I have several grease guns, including another Lincoln manual grease gun, and this gun primes real easy. I typically don't have to do anything, it primes itself. It reduces my workload considerably. A must have in any garage/shop where you need to frequently grease the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been constantly frustrated by the "cheap" grease guns purchased at big box stores ($15). They're super messy and are not well built. This one has plenty of threads to engage the canister to the head, an easy to use bleeder and a pretty stout plunger. Much better than the crap I purchased previously. Grease does not come oozing out of every orifice the first time you pressurize it. VERY happy with this purchase. Hopefully the last one I'll ever buy. Side Note - I'd highly recommend investing in a "Lock n Lube" coupler. It will make the use of this grease gun 100x better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well built!
customer_reviews.text: I have been greasing cars, jets, machines, etc for 35+ years and this grease gun is one of the nicest hand pump grease gun I have ever used. It is very well built and after its primed works great. Make no mistake, priming any hand pump grease gun sucks. Its just the nature of the beast. So once you get this primed, it works great. The colder the grease is, the thicker it is, hence the harder it is to prime.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: works ok if you have 3 hands-lever doesn;t retract on it's own so kind of difficult to use without 3 hands-other than that works good-grease my farm equipment daily so not really pleased with this product-
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I really should have bought one of these a long time ago. I hated changing the grease in my trucks and trailers because my hands would ache from squeezing the pump so many times, especially with my trailer axles. This unit makes it so easy and simple. Its now a 10 minute job to do both axles on my trailer where it would take almost an hour before. Awesome unit!
customer_reviews.author: GrimmRoper

customer_reviews.title: Grease gun.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because of incomplete directions. If it weren't for another reviewer I wouldn't have known to loosen the coupler sections. Loosening the coupler assembly sections kept the the coupler from getting stuck on a recessed grease fitting on my tractor. The directions show the coupler as one piece. I used a wrench and pliers to loosen the two sections. The pieces are tightly fitted together. Do this before you use it. Now it works great. You can now adjust it to properly fit your grease fittings .
customer_reviews.author: Tom G

customer_reviews.title: He Needed This...
customer_reviews.text: My hubby picked this out as one of his bday presents. He opened immediately & finished up greasing his 1953 Jubilee. It was easy & enjoying for him to use compared to the pc of crap he refused to throw away until I convinced him to do so. Such a cheapskate. Anywho-this could be the one you need too!
customer_reviews.author: TheFleur

customer_reviews.title: Reloading grease is a pain
customer_reviews.text: OK, everyone was raving about this grease gun so I chose it over others. However, I have the hardest time when trying to reload it. You're supposed to pull the handle back and lock it back (there's a little groove for the handle to move into, but mine won't go). Like all other grease guns, getting the air out sucks (no pun intended) but it works like a charm once you get it all dialed in.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L.

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: reliability and well made. best my husband has ever used. he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Drum1Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good grease gun.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grease gun I've ever owned. It's well made and once it's primed it works well. Like all grease guns, it's a little challenge to get it primed and started. The bleed valve helps a little, but I wish they could figure out a way to make this easier. Also the coupler it comes with is weak. I ended up buying an Alemite one for it that is must better at sealing. Over all I do recommend this gun, because I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality grease gun. Couple it with a lock and lube fitting and it’s awesome. Very simple to bleed the air out when changing the tube of grease and it holds the prime very well.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this thing does just fine. I noticed in my climate which is really hot, sometimes I have to reprime the plunger, which could also simply be an issue with the grease cartridges I'm using. But once attached to a grease nib, it worked fine and the head released easily when done.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeyanvil

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and leaky
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive and it leaks and is covered in grease. My local bought generic works much better. Save your money here and get something less expensive. It is a constant mess.
customer_reviews.author: ElohseeKay

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous grease gun
customer_reviews.text: If it is possible to get all giddy over a tool this is it. I got this to replace my old box store $30 single shot gun that had poor clearances and would only fire with very high input air pressure. Mostly the air just leaked around the piston and it made noise with no grease. Not so the Lincoln. It simply works great with no air leaking by. Being "automatic" it fires pretty rapidly to keep a continuous stream of grease coming as long as the trigger is held down. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Raybert

customer_reviews.title: Has design flaw
customer_reviews.text: There is a circular plate that pushes on the grease. For every other gun, when you insert the grease cylinder, the plate is positioned slightly inside the cylinder. For this gun, it is outside. So, when you release the handle, it get stuck. The first time I used it, it actually worked for me, so I bought the second one, because I use two types of greases. Afterwards I realized that neither gun is working, ad this is for two different greases, two different producers. I am writing this review because I decided to discard both guns.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Aslanidi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy whatever cheap grease gun i can get my hands on when I need one, but after a little research decided on the Lincoln. What a difference! The extra cost is well worth it. Well made, high quality, easy to use. Makes a unpleasant task easier to do
customer_reviews.author: Alan E. Borg

customer_reviews.title: Nice Middle-Range Quality Grease Gun
customer_reviews.text: Decent grease gun ... definitely not the best one I own but its much cheaper than my high-end grease guns hence I have it mounted in the machine shed for the grease on the go jobs and I'm not to worried about someone stealing it! If your looking a grease gun that doesn't hurt your wallet yet isn't a piece of garbage ... then I'd say this one fits the bit quite well!
customer_reviews.author: Weaver Cattle Company

customer_reviews.title: Good quality grease gun.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grease gun after another brand(cheaper) failed after a little more then a year. I can tell this is better built, solid pump and handle and will last longer. I do wish the output was a little more. It's about half the output then my old one, which means more squeezes. It's a little difficult to bleed(but most are). I haven't used the hard or flexable line that came with it as I'm using an extended flexable line that I bought for hard to reach fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Welty

customer_reviews.title: Works great once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: I'm knocking off one star because the instructions are terrible and it's made in India. Once I figured out how to finagle the plunger into the grease cartridge to get it started everything worked fine. I wasn't used to a plunger fitting that tightly. Quality grease gun, quality hose and quality zerk fitting. Much better than my other grease guns. If the instructions were better and it was made in the USA it would easily get 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Truth

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Finally A decent grease gun. I deserve this and no one can tell me otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Quality professional tool.
customer_reviews.text: This grease gun makes short work out of every job its used on, from heavy equipment to powersports. I am extremely impressed with its speed. Make sure you replace the hose tip with "Lock & Lube" end, and everything you grease will be done in seconds. Very happy with the Lincoln 1162 grease gun!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bonagura

customer_reviews.title: Better than Harbor Freight grease guns
customer_reviews.text: Save the frustration associated with cheap grease guns. You will end up purchasing the more expensive product in the long run. The quality of this gun is apparent from the time it is unwrapped to when you put the grease in it and find it actually works as it should. And, it will continue working for years to come. I would give it five stars but the finish does not seem to match the quality in the older Lincolns.
customer_reviews.author: Trail Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Lincoln quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a cartridge gun, as it does not come with a bulk fill fitting. It does have a removable plug in an 1/8" NPT fill port, so you could add a Lincoln 91108 filler nipple.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: The longer handle makes it so much easier to push down to get the grease into the zerks
customer_reviews.text: We like everything about this grease gun. Our old one finally had to be replaced but no one locally had a long hndled one, so we had to order one. So glad we did. This one is made very well and should last the rest of our lives for sure.
customer_reviews.author: LCLTx

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Great for the first tube of grease after that grease bypassed the follower and would only pump 1/2 a tube of grease the rest of it comes out the charge handle when you pull it back to insert another tube of grease. I grease heavy equipment everyday and this is the worst grease gun on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Handy to use under a Jeep
customer_reviews.text: I have always had lever type grease guns at home... what a pain.. Now with this I just tap the trigger and it is done. I set the pressure that was recommended and greased a axle u joint that never would take it before... Made it worth the money
customer_reviews.author: RLB

customer_reviews.title: Lincoln 1162
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an air operated Grease gun from a local automotive parts store. It only lasted for one and a half' Grease cartridges before failing. I returned it for a refund. I ordered the Lincoln Grease gun, and it arrived on time. Taking it right out of the box you could tell it was a quality made product. I installed a grease with cartridge, purged the gun and greased some machinery. All you have to do this to pull and hold the trigger and it continuously Greases. The other grease gun you had to pull and release the trigger every time you wanted to add Grease. Save time and money and purchase the Lincoln 1162 than the grease gun.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat a Lincoln
customer_reviews.text: Great grease gun, cant go wrong with a Lincoln! I will probably buy the pistol grip one also as I feel they both have their place. This one is good for the tractor that takes more than one-two pumps per fitting, but the pistol grip would be easier on my rhino when I'm having to use it one handed by myself in hard to reach places on stubborn fittings. All in all satisfied with the gun though.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying to use keeps getting air locked
customer_reviews.text: It take a few minutes to clear the air from it. It gets air locked 3 or 4 times each tube. Same grease in my other guns work fine. Like it when it works but it stops frequently and needs to be bleed. Very annoying
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: What’s not to love?
customer_reviews.text: How did I get by without this? One hand to hold the fitting on the zert one to pull the trigger! I’ve only run three tubes of grease thru it so far but it seems well made & it’s easy to bleed & use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N.

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed and reduces forearm soreness.
customer_reviews.text: Best grease gun I ever owned, it's super easy to load and with an air line I specifically built to run pneumatic equipment that has a built in water separator and pressure regulator you can slow the flow rate to a manageable level. On items that require or allow for purge lubrication this is the best option. This gun cuts the time it takes to grease components to a few minutes instead of the usual ten to fifteen it takes by doing the same job by hand plus it lowers the amount of repetitive motion required to squeeze the conventional grease gun which means less sore forearms and increase mileage before carpal tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: HeloFxr84

customer_reviews.title: Complete failure!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Lincoln grease gun and it was a complete failure. It would not prime and it took forever to get a tube loaded in it. It ruined 2 tubes of expensive Amsoil synthetic grease. I’m not a rookie and I’ve got a lot of time behind a grease gun. I’m sending it back and going after Lincoln for my 2 tubes of grease on principal. I didn’t realize until I read the box that it’s made in India!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made grease gun!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and assembled quickly. I did have an issue getting any pump action the first time. Turns out I had some sort of air lock somehow and It wasn't until I released pressure from the top port that grease was starting to push through the hose and out the end. Also worth mentioning, the end piece is in fact two pieces. You just need to get a good grip on the end and a wrench on the nut to separate them.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cyhanick

customer_reviews.title: Go with this one, it works!
customer_reviews.text: Using for greasing tractor. Made mistake of trying a cheaper brand earlier. Should have known better. It went in trash can. I’ve already got a Lincoln grease gun that works perfectly for my needs, so I ordered this one to match! Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Norvin E.

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are horrible. They are confusing and useless
customer_reviews.text: This item seems well built and suited to the light duty I will give it. The instructions are horrible. They are confusing and useless. I suggest going online and looking at videos on how to install a new cartridge and remove a used one. Again, I cannot emphasize this enough. The instructions tell you to remove both the head and plunger assemblies. This is inaccurate. Other than trying to figure out how to use it, the product is as advertised and I look forward to putting it to use. I'll report more later.
customer_reviews.author: SecurityGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice grease gun
customer_reviews.text: When my old one wore out I took a chance on this Lincoln Lubrication 1134 Heavy Duty Pistol Grip Grease Gun. Getting the first tube of grease to function was not an issue at all, the air bled out easily. The plunger can be reversed if using bulk grease. Nice feel and function to the pistol grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow- Buy it Now!
customer_reviews.text: If you do any substantial greasing to machines or equipment this is a "game-changer" must have product! Affordable & Well built. It cut my grease times down by at least 50%- be sure to combo this with the "lock & lube" coupler tip and you will have no regrets!...other than you should have bought it sooner! Buy it Now!
customer_reviews.author: Fasttrac!

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid so far
customer_reviews.text: Be warned that it takes some time and fidgeting with it to get the pump primed initially but after that it's a solid grease gun. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the grease fitting is a little strange to work with. After loosening and adjusting it, I still can't get it to grab onto fittings well enough to not leak without some force applied to it.
customer_reviews.author: LastingMagnet

customer_reviews.title: Built to last!
customer_reviews.text: Hard a hard time deciding which greese gun to choose among the many listed on Amazon, but I'm glad I ended up choosing this one. You immediately notice that it's built to last -- this thing is SOLID. Very easy to prime and use, very satisfied and would purchase it again!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Root

customer_reviews.title: Great grease gun, bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: I must have been jinxed. All my recent automotive orders arrive looking like they were with General Custer at the Little Big Horn. Item was great, but the box... total mess. Old, yellow packaging, dog eared, previously wet/stained... c'mon what are sellers doing, dumping liquidated merchandise?
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made and didnt work!!
customer_reviews.text: Arived and didnt work air just came out the little weep hole on the side ,,i purged all air out ,,took apart to make sure spring and plunger werent stuck put back together same thing , when you pull trogger air came out the little weep hole,, and air also leaked all the way around the top part of the of the trigger portion that holds the air diaphram and spring and valve,,,, uses a paper gasket instead of a o ring ,, just made a cheap as possible,, but thanks to Amazon great customer service got a instant refund so i can buy one that is quality made
customer_reviews.author: Adam B Nevins

customer_reviews.title: Lincoln 1134
customer_reviews.text: This one replaces my worn out one. for the 1 week I have had it - I like this one so far, heavy duty handle assy looks to be good quality, nothing leaks so far, 14.5 oz Cartridge fits good & it expels air in just a few pumps. Other reviewers had trouble with the nozzle attachment to zerk fittings, I have not had any troubles with this, my nozzle snaps on with a push & pulls off just fine without any adjustment. This one can be filled from a bulk supply also. Instructions could have been better but it's up and running just fine. Hope this one lasts 30 years like the last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: First time grease gun user - this was great!
customer_reviews.text: You need to buy grease, this gun doesn't come with any grease! This is my first grease gun, I bought it based on the reviews. After getting the unit I also had a problem removing the connector from a zurk. I found this YouTube video that really explained it better than anyone else had ([...]). If the link doesn't work, basically, you just turn the connector to the side, like a 45 degree angle on the zurk and it pops right off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wheaton

customer_reviews.title: Great Gun
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this grease gun, 3' flexible extension, hold down bracket and needle type fitting. I mounted the whole works on a 4"x1"x18" piece of oak. What I ended up with is a Grease gun that could sit on the ground with a long flexible hose that I use to grease the Cv Joints on my Sand Rail. The needle point lets me get the grease in behind the Cv race to properly lube the joint. I have used this setup for quite a while now and can say that the Lincoln gun and all parts work Flawlessly. I highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Super Hunky

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use grease gun...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new grease gun and this has worked well for me. Its design allows easier one handed operation, a very big plus when greasing drive lines. It uses standard grease tubes and is easy to load. Overall, very happy with my purchase...
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Had this in a wish list forever and finally pulled the trigger. Very glad I did! So much easier/faster than hand pumping. Don't wait like I did, just get it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gun
customer_reviews.text: I almost gave up on finding a quality grease gun. This gun is great. Smooth and easy to pump one handed. The tip grabs on and pulls off with just the right amount of force. This gun actually bleeds easily and quickly. I highly recommend it. Don't bother with cheaper guns.
customer_reviews.author: Dean B.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a cheapie grease gun from northern tool to grease my mower and truck. It didn't work well and I always hated/struggled with greasing. After talking to some people and reading reviews online i bought what everyone said is one of the best guns out there. As soon as I took it out of the box I could tell it was a quality item. I immediately loaded it up with grease and snapped the hose onto a zerk. a few pumps and grease was flushing out like it was supposed to. Made the greasing chore so much easier. I tossed my generic gun and now I look forward to greasing my toys.
customer_reviews.author: beans4me

customer_reviews.title: 1 time use on Grease Gun
customer_reviews.text: My husband greased his semi truck he tried to use it to grease something else on the truck and it will not work no more. So he was able to use it but1 time.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Manuel

customer_reviews.title: High quality grease gun
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought one like this long ago. I was using one of the little mini-guns and this makes that look like junk. Well made, sturdy, reliable, great tool. Top quality.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: A New Must Have
customer_reviews.text: OMG, just buy it! This gun combined with my Lock N Lube coupler is something I should have invested in years ago! Would you believe me if I told you I was able to get an excavator idler arm to move with this combo. The same idler arm that we’ve already purchased a replacement for because we couldn’t get it to move even with hydraulic rams!! To say the least, I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: never leaked in any way along with an original LockNLube Grease Coupler attached its the best. It has good a fit and finishes quality ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a review after two years of regular use. It has never let me done, never leaked in any way along with an original LockNLube Grease Coupler attached its the best. It has good a fit and finishes quality and craftsmanship. It should serve very well for many years.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Malone

customer_reviews.title: put it together & start using it.
customer_reviews.text: this is my 2nd one & I like it. greasing my riding lawn mower & tractor with loader is so much easier & faster than a hand one. very handy
customer_reviews.author: bentley 5614

customer_reviews.title: Lincoln 1162 Air Operated Grease Gun really does the job with ease!
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice product / tool to have on hand. The tool is well made and comes with some really cool attachments that were not even mentioned in it's listing. If you work in shop or by yourself then you know how hard it is to get into places that need grease and then try to pump the grease with a standard gun. Well, this tool makes all of the grease work as snap! I just recently grease a 7-ton Case 580 Backhoe with this tool and I was very pleased with the ease, speed and power of this air operated grease gun.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Loaded with Mercury 2-4-C for boat and trailer. Cost a little more than some. Worth it so far as it's super easy to use and not messy. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Skookum as frig
customer_reviews.text: Follow the priming instructions provided in other reviews here (don't remove the bleeder screw -- just loosen it) and have some patience. Works great. Appears to be a sound design with sturdy materials. No Chinesium here.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnar

customer_reviews.title: Wasted tube of grease
customer_reviews.text: I watched tutorials on how to prime this thing and still failed. I am an adult who can follow instructions yet yet I was unable to prime this gun. Just ended up with a big mess and wasted expensive tube of silicone grease
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Grease Gun
customer_reviews.text: Works great. High quality build and robust looking castings. The pistol pump action is convenient and provides plenty of pressure. Grease tubes load easily. The end of the hose fits easily on grease fittings, yet provides good flow without grease waste. Would rate five stars if this was still made in America.
customer_reviews.author: Woodtick Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this grease gun so far. After reading some of the reviews I was skeptical... From opening the box to use it took me less than 10 minutes. I will say you might as well order a new end because the one they sent wouldn't fit the average size grease fittings. In addition I would just go and buy the Male air hose connector. The one they sent was a whacky one. I had all of these things on the shelf so it was no problem for me. So far very happy. It sent grease in fittings my manual would not. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brenneman

customer_reviews.title: Lincoln Lubrication 1134 Heavy Duty Pistol Grip Grease Gun with Whip Hose and Rigid Pipe
customer_reviews.text: This Pistol is exactly as described easy to fill and use. No more grease all over the place when greasing my riding mower.
customer_reviews.author: TrainaK9

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: It is nice that you can put in a single squirt of grease, or hold down the the trigger for continuous pumping, the only thing I don't like is that the fitting for the grease zerks is EXTREMELY hard to get on and off of the grease zerk, I finally had to buy a different fitting
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Cup seal bypasses grease
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a brand new cartridge but if left to sit the grease bypasses the cup and will fill the cavity behind where the spring and rod are. Completely cleaned it out and double checked the cup seal on two separate occasions before loading a new cartridge and within one month of a new cartridge the grease had all bypassed the seal. Chucked it and I'll be looking for a higher quality replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Meschi

customer_reviews.title: Sprainef a finger-Spring exploded
customer_reviews.text: We loaded the grease gun and when closing, the spring exploded, warped, sprained a finger, and now is non-returnable!
customer_reviews.author: Hand tool beginner

customer_reviews.title: Can't bulk fill
customer_reviews.text: I do not use the cartridges and I have been unable to use it yet, it has a special bulk fill nipple that does not fit my bulk fill pump and they want $38 for an adaptor. The thread size is metric and will not accept the fill nipple that fits my pump. I am considering returning it and getting another brand.
customer_reviews.author: movnrn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Like the lever action as compared to pistol grip type. I also bought a clamp on nozzle to go with this gun
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nobling

customer_reviews.title: Really good grease.gun
customer_reviews.text: Have tried other grease guns, this is the best one yet. If you hold the trigger it continues to pump Can not go wrong with Lincoln. It's what they do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Not Made in USA, BUT well made
customer_reviews.text: The advertisement on Amazon said Made in USA, but the box is labeled "Made in India". When I opened the box, I could see that this grease gun is well made. I suggest you read the instructions for loading a cartridge of grease. I really didn't have any problems with getting the grease to flow though I didn't follow the instructions to the letter. The instructions say to let a small amount of grease squeeze out from between the cartridge tube and the head as you push the plunger in. I didn't, but it worked anyway.
customer_reviews.author: G. Barbier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool
customer_reviews.text: really fast pumping and nice built tool, cutting my greasing time from an hour to barely 25 minutes, i wish they came up with double barrel grease cartridge because when you are more excited pumping a grease fitting you run out of grease, beside that is the perfect greasing tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Alvarez del Real

customer_reviews.title: Solid and does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job. No issues thus far. Read the priming guide. I suspect a lot of the 'issues' people have are because they aren't paying attention to recommendations. The tip does 'hold tightly' but I had no real issue removing it. I do not look on this as a negative. Make sure you tighten the tip onto the hose well. It come separately, and initially, I did not tighten it as well as I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

product_meta.title: Lincoln 1162 Fully Automatic Heavy Duty Pneumatic Grease Gun, Air-Operated, Variable Speed Trigger, 30 Inch High-Pressure Hose, Combination Filler Coupler/Air Bleeder Valve
product_meta.description:
Since 1910, agriculture, construction, industrial and vehicle service facilities require tools that withstand rugged and frequent use in demanding environments. The Lincoln 1162 fully automatic pneumatic grease gun is an industry standard and is time-tested and proven and includes an 30-inch whip hose to meet all lubrication tasks. This gun is fully automatic and its variable-speed trigger provides excellent control of grease flow so you can apply as littler or as much as you need with the squeeze of a finger. The accessible check valve allows for easy cleaning and removal of hardened or contaminated grease, and the combination filler Coupler and air bleeder allows users to bulk fill the grease tube then easily release any trapped air to keep the grease gun primed.

At every farm, construction site, automobile repair shop and industrial plant, maintenance professionals need high quality lubrication equipment and pumping products. Lincoln offers everything you need for lubrication. Our general-purpose tools and heavy-duty pumps, hose reels, meters and controls, used fluid systems and hand-held lubrication products are the best in the industry. LINCOLN – THE BRAND THE PROS DEMAND.
feature_bullets: Fully automatic with continuous operation and grease flow
Variable-speed trigger provides excellent grease flow control
30 inch high-pressure hose with coupler and attachment clip
Includes combination filler coupler/air bleeder to bulk fill and easily release trapped air to keep grease gun primed
6,000 psi maximum grease pressure Accessible check valve allows for easy cleaning of hardened and/or contaminated grease

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars884 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
